cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 785 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, then turning northwest while slowing, on approach to the North Carolina/South Carolina coastline

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (hurricane) and storm-surge watch same stretch
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds (hurricane & storm-surge warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire South Carolina and North Carolina coastline, extending into southeast Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) increasingly likely Thursday night into Friday; small (≈11%) chance of 50-kt gusts
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft above ground possible for Edisto Beach–South Santee River, including Charleston Harbor; higher if the track shifts south
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 6–12 inches with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood risk and river flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged periods of elevated water levels if the storm stalls inland
